text: Jordan Roberts (born 2 January 1993) is an English footballer. ==Career== ===College=== Roberts played four years of college soccer at Quincy University between 2011 and 2014. At Quincy, Roberts scored 52 goals in 82 appearances.http://quhawks.com/roster.aspx?rp_id=1924 Roberts also appeared for USL PDL side St. Louis Lions in 2014.http://www.uslpdl.com/teams/2014/4069049.html#STATS ===Professional=== Roberts signed with USL side Saint Louis FC on 10 March 2015.http://www.uslsoccer.com/ViewArticle.dbml?DB_OEM_ID=32800&ATCLID;=209951611 He made his first professional appearance during a match against Wilmington Hammerheads FC at World Wide Technology Soccer Park on 9 May 2015.http://saintlouisfc.com/sports/msoc/2014-15/boxscores/20150509_krv1.xml ==Personal life== Roberts' father, Alan, played more than 200 matches in the English Football League in the 1980s before his career was ended by injury. ==References== ==External links== * *Quincy University bio *Saint Louis FC bio Category:1993 births Category:Living people Category:English footballers Category:English expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate soccer players in the United States Category:Quincy Hawks men's soccer players Category:St. Louis Lions players Category:Saint Louis FC players Category:Reno 1868 FC players Category:Association football forwards Category:USL League Two players Category:USL Championship players Category:English expatriate sportspeople in the United States
title: Jordan Roberts (footballer, born 1993)
